<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_init_page_sizes:
```c
static int metal_init_page_sizes(void)
{
	const int max_sizes = MAX_PAGE_SIZES - 1;
	long sizes[max_sizes];

	/* Determine system page size. */
	sizes[0] = getpagesize();
	if (sizes[0] <= 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to get page size\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	_metal.page_size  = sizes[0];
	_metal.page_shift = metal_log2(sizes[0]);
	metal_add_page_size(_metal.tmp_path, _metal.page_shift, 0);

#ifdef HAVE_HUGETLBFS_H
#ifndef MAP_HUGE_SHIFT
	/* System does not support multiple huge page sizes. */
	sizes[0] = gethugepagesize();
	if (sizes[0] > 0) {
		metal_add_page_size(hugetlbfs_find_path(),
				    metal_log2(sizes[0]),
				    MAP_HUGETLB);
	}
#else
	if (gethugepagesize() >= 0) {
		int i, count;

		/* System supports multiple huge page sizes. */
		count = gethugepagesizes(sizes, max_sizes);
		for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
			int shift = metal_log2(sizes[i]);

			if ((shift & MAP_HUGE_MASK) != shift)
				continue;
			metal_add_page_size(
				hugetlbfs_find_path_for_size(sizes[i]),
				shift, (MAP_HUGETLB |
				(shift << MAP_HUGE_SHIFT)));
		}
	}
#endif
#endif

	/* Finally sort the resulting array by size. */
	qsort(_metal.page_sizes, _metal.num_page_sizes,
	      sizeof(struct metal_page_size), metal_pagesize_compare);

	return 0;
}
```

explanation:
No controlling expressions in the provided function are statically invariant, so there are no fragments that need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. Specific points considered:

- if (sizes[0] <= 0) — sizes[0] is assigned from getpagesize() earlier in the function; this is not a compile-time invariant.
- if (sizes[0] > 0) in the MAP_HUGE_SHIFT-not-defined branch — sizes[0] is assigned from gethugepagesize() immediately prior; not invariant.
- if (gethugepagesize() >= 0) in the MAP_HUGE_SHIFT-defined branch — calling a function means the expression is not a constant invariant.
- for (i = 0; i < count; i++) — loop bound count is obtained from gethugepagesizes(sizes, max_sizes); not a compile-time invariant.
- Preprocessor conditionals (#ifdef HAVE_HUGETLBFS_H, #ifndef MAP_HUGE_SHIFT) are handled at translation/preprocessing time and are not subject to MISRA Rule 14.3 which addresses C controlling expressions.

No other if/while/do/for/switch controlling expressions are present that are obvious compile-time invariants (e.g., literal constants or expressions guaranteed not to change). Therefore no suspicious fragments are reported.
